catalog.name: Resource
catalog.description:
This collection includes information on the renewable energy resources available in the area, which is essential for a detailed characterization of the study area and for analyzing the development potential of an energy system in the area. These data can be valid inputs to models for the energy planning of the territory.

Stock photo by Vecteezy

members.description: This collection includes information on the wind resource available on the territory.

members.name: Hydroelectric
members.description: This collection includes information about the hydroelectric resource.

members.name: Maximum hydroelectric potential (GWh/year)
members.description:
The maps of the maximum hydroelectric potential show the maximum gross energy obtainable from hydroenergy exploitation (GWh/year) in each sub-basin considered in the Italian territory. The calculation considers the spatial distribution of the average annual precipitation, the flow coefficients, the topographic relief (DEM) and the minimum vital flow (DMV) equal to 10% of the natural flow.
It is important to underline that the calculation does not take into account the current uses of water (hydroelectric, irrigation, potable, etc.) and therefore the total value of the maximum Italian hydroelectric producibility is approximately 190,000 GWh/year. This purely theoretical value would imply being able to convert all the available water potential into electrical energy, an unrealistic hypothesis from both a technical and an environmental point of view. A plausible value of the actual exploitation can be considered approximately 25% of the maximum hydroelectric producibility, a percentage that could be reached and possibly exceeded with the construction of distributed generation plants (mini-hydroelectric).

Two components are considered for the calculation of the maximum potential:
  • the basin's own production capacity;
  • the producibility deriving from the flow rates that come from upstream, with jump from upstream height to downstream height.


The two components for calculating the maximum hydroelectric potential

To explore the issue relating to the hydroelectric resource of a specific river basin, you can use the tools developed in RdS: VAPIDRO-ASTE allows you to automatically calculate the river network of the area of ​​interest. The user chooses a river branch in which he wants to calculate the potential hydroelectric producibility along the different river stretches. To deepen the aspects of technical and economic feasibility, the software SMART Mini-Idro allows you to analyze different project proposals by identifying the most convenient one.

members.name: Specific hydroelectric potential (GWh/year/m)
members.description:
The maps of the maximum hydroelectric potential illustrate the maximum specific energy for unit length obtainable from hydroenergy exploitation (GWh/year/m) in each sub-basin considered in the Italian territory. The calculation takes into account the spatial distribution of the average annual precipitation, the flow coefficients, the topographic relief (DEM) and the minimum vital flow (DMV) equal to 10% of the natural flow.

The specific potential considers two different energy contributions:
  • the basin's own production capacity;
  • the producibility deriving from the flow rates coming from upstream, with Hupstream-Hdownstream head.


The two components for calculating the maximum hydroelectric potential

The energy coming from the exploitation of the upstream flow rates is related to the distance L, corresponding to the structural development of a hypothetical plant which draws water from the inlet point of the basins that flow upstream and returns it to the closing section of the basin under analysis; the own energy is instead related to an equivalent distance, defined as the square root of the basin surface.

Methodology for drafting maps of hydroelectric production at the basin scale Per approfondire la tematica relativa alla risorsa idroelettrica di uno specifico bacino fluviale si può ricorrere a dei tool sviluppati in RdS: Software SMART Mini-Idro

members.name: Historical data
members.description: This collection includes historical data from rain gauges and hydrometers as well as the duration curves of some hydrographic basins.

members.name: Hydrometric data
members.description:
Map of measuring stations: it is possible to view the position of the stations and download their historical data. Hydrometric measurements of the IDROSTAZ database deriving from historical data published in the annals of the Hydrographic Service. Note: The service has stopped collecting data since 1998 when the service was moved to regions.
For further details: Ispra ambiente

members.name: Rainfall data
members.description:
Map of measuring stations: it is possible to view the position of the stations and download their historical data. Rainfall measurements from the IDROSTAZ database deriving from historical data published in the annals of the Hydrographic Service.

Note: The service has stopped collecting data since 1998 when it was moved to the regions.
For further details: Ispra ambiente

members.name: Flow duration curve
members.description:
Duration curves for the assessment of foreseeable water availability at the closure section of a predetermined hydrographic basin. Processing is available in the following areas: Abruzzo-Marche, Adamello and Orobie and Graian and Pennine Alps.

Additional information: Software SMART Mini-Idro

members.name: Solar
members.description: This collection includes information about the solar resource. For further information, see the dedicated solar atlas SunRISE

members.name: Average value of the annual sum of global radiation (kWh/m²)
members.description:
Map of the average global radiation referring to the period 2005-2015 and expressed in kWh/m2 The map was created using data from the RADSAF archive of global ground irradiance estimated on the Italian territory, using a methodology developed by RSE. The methodology is based on the processing of images taken by the MSG (Meteosat Second Generation) geostationary satellite placed at an altitude of 36,000 km above the Gulf of Guinea which entirely covers the Italian territory. The spatial resolution of the images is about 3-5 km, the temporal resolution of 15 minutes. An algorithm called SAFNWC, jointly developed by various European meteorological institutes, allows automatic recognition of cloud cover and its type starting from the satellite images acquired every 15 minutes by a ground receiving station with which RSE is equipped.

Information about the SOLAR RESOURCE layer
Solar Atlas (sunRise).

members.name: Marine
members.description: This collection includes information about marine energy.

members.name: Offshore wave potential
members.description: This collection includes information on offshore wave potential.

members.name: Offshore wave motion
members.description:
Map of average wave power density (kW/m) at predefined points. 

  Within the information associated with each point are reported in addition to the average wave energy (kW/m), also the depth (m) and distance from the coast (km) for which the offshore wave motion conditions are verified. 
 For further information: 

 - Besio, G., Mentaschi, L. and Mazzino, A., 2016. Wave energy resource assessment in the Mediterranean Sea on the basis of a 35-year hindcast. Energy, 94, pp.50-63. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.energy.2015.10.044 

 - Lira-Loarca, A., Ferrari, F., Mazzino, A. and Besio, G., 2021. Future wind and wave energy resources and exploitability in the Mediterranean Sea by 2100. Applied Energy, Elsevier vol.302, https://doi.org/10.1016/j.apenergy.2021.117492 

 - Rapporto RSE RdS prot. 20010732

members.name: Offshore potential of devices
members.description: This collection includes information regarding simulations performed on the offshore wave potential of some devices.

members.name: AquaBuOY - Capacity Factor
members.description:
Offshore wave potential of some devices: AquaBuOY 

 This map describes the characteristics of each device for the points analysed off the Italian coast. The following are shown: the best scale factor (-), the capacity factor (-), annual energy produced (kWh), nominal capacity of the device (kW).

 For further information, see the RSE report RdS prot. 20010732

members.name: Potential wave motion shoreline
members.description: This collection includes information on existing piers potentially suitable for wave motion exploitation for electricity production.

members.name: Piers exploitable for wave motion
members.description: Map of existing piers potentially suitable for wave motion exploitation for electricity production.

members.name: Measurement campaigns
members.description: This collection includes measurements made at monitoring points

members.name: Wave measurement campaigns - Civitavecchia
members.description:
Measurements of wave motion and current flows carried out in the periods: 9th February 2017 - 12th March 2017, 12th March 2017 - 08th June 2017 and 10th October 2017 - 20th December 2017, in the stretch of sea in front of the port of Civitavecchia at about 40 m depth: wave height, currents, speed and direction, peak period, available power. Additional information:

RSE RdS document prot. 17002141.

members.name: MOBI buoy measurement campaigns - Strait of Sicily
members.description: MOBI - Offshore measuring station on floating buoy

members.name: Power flow of currents (W/m²)
members.description:
Map of the specific power flow of marine currents in Italian seas on a synoptic scale (RSE Report RdS prot. 12000352 of 03/31/2012). The spatial resolution of the results obtained is in fact linked to the temporal resolution of the current values ​​used for processing. Reference is made to the numerical results available at http://marine.copernicus.eu, with daily current values ​​relating to the period 2004-2010, with a horizontal resolution of approximately 7 km and arranged on 71 vertical levels. Only sites close enough to the coast (maximum 10 km away) and at fairly modest depths (less than 50 m) are considered feasible. The specific power flow represents the power supplied by the current per unit of useful section of the turbine, at the point along the vertical line, where this flow has its maximum value. The resulting map provides general indications (given the approximation linked to the temporal resolution of the speed averages) for meso- and micro-scale studies, for the purpose of exploiting energy from marine currents in Italian waters.

Information about the MARINE RESOURCE layer MARENERGY

members.name: Geothermal
members.description: This collection includes information about the geothermal resource.

members.name: Temperature at 1000 m depth (°C)
members.description: Map of subsoil temperatures expressed in degrees Celsius at a depth of 1000 meters from ground level. Map developed by RSE S.p.A. starting from the data collected in the Inventory of National Geothermal Resources available on the website of the Ministry of Ecological Transition - UNMIG (https://unmig.mise.gov.it/index.php/it/dati/risorse-geotermiche/inventario-delle-risorse-geotermiche-nazionali). Additional information: GEO WebGIS CCS -- Geothermal -- Gas storage

members.name: Temperature at 2000 m depth (°C)
members.description: Map of subsoil temperatures expressed in degrees Celsius at a depth of 2000 meters from ground level. Map developed by RSE S.p.A. starting from the data collected in the Inventory of National Geothermal Resources available on the website of the Ministry of Ecological Transition - UNMIG (https://unmig.mise.gov.it/index.php/it/dati/risorse-geotermiche/inventario-delle-risorse-geotermiche-nazionali). Additional information: GEO WebGIS CCS -- Geothermal -- Gas storage

members.name: Temperature at 3000 m depth (°C)
members.description: Map of subsoil temperatures expressed in degrees Celsius at a depth of 3000 meters from ground level. Map developed by RSE S.p.A. starting from the data collected in the Inventory of National Geothermal Resources available on the website of the Ministry of Ecological Transition - UNMIG (https://unmig.mise.gov.it/index.php/it/dati/risorse-geotermiche/inventario-delle-risorse-geotermiche-nazionali). Additional information: GEO WebGIS CCS -- Geothermal -- Gas storage

members.name: Heat flow (mW/m²)
members.description: Superficial heat flux map expressed in mW/m2 prepared by RSE S.p.A. using the data collected in the Inventory of National Geothermal Resources available on the website of the Ministry of Ecological Transition - UNMIG (https://unmig.mise.gov.it/index.php/it/dati/risorse-geotermiche/inventario-delle-risorse-geotermiche-nazionali). Additional information: GEO WebGIS CCS -- Geothermal -- Gas storage

members.name: Potential reservoir top level (m asl)
members.description: The map shows the top level, in meters asl, of the roof of the potential carbonate tank. The carbonate complex, being characterized by a significant permeability, by considerable thicknesses and by a high area extension, is the main reservoir of Italian geothermal fields. The map was elaborated by RSE S.p.A. starting from the data collected in the Inventory of National Geothermal Resources available on the website of the Ministry of Economic Development - DGS-UNMIG (https://unmig.mise.gov.it/index.php/it/dati/risorse-geotermiche/inventario-delle-risorse-geotermiche-nazionali). Additional information: GEO WebGIS CCS -- Geothermal -- Gas storage

members.name: Geothermal zoning
members.description: Geothermal zoning supports the identification on a municipal scale of areas in which there are significant increases in subsoil temperatures at lower depths than the average which generate the theoretical conditions necessary to draw heat, supporting the identification of a possible geothermal fluid reservoir industrially usable. This map shows the following information for each municipality: - the minimum, average and maximum temperature (°C) at 1,000, 2,000 and 3,000 meters of depth (fields: T1000, T2000 and T3000); - The minimum, average and maximum heat flow (mW/m2) (fields: Flow) ; - the minimum, average and maximum depth (meters) of the roof of rocks potentially suitable for containing a geothermal system (carbonate reservoir roof where mapped) (fields: Carbo). NThe map displayed shows, by way of example, the distribution of the average temperature parameter at a depth of 1,000 m, but by selecting the appropriate legend it is possible to view the distribution of the other parameters present. Additional information: GEO WebGIS CCS -- Geothermal -- Gas storage

members.name: Depth of areas with homogeneous temperature of 120° C (meters)
members.description: Depth maps related to the temperature of 120° C. Map developed by RSE S.p.A. starting from the data collected in the Inventory of National Geothermal Resources available on the website of the Ministry of Ecological Transition - UNMIG (https://unmig.mise.gov.it/index.php/it/dati/risorse-geotermiche/inventario-delle-risorse-geotermiche-nazionali).

members.name: Producible geothermal potential (MWh/year)
members.description: Geothermal map potential at municipal level: for the areas of the Italian territory that have a temperature greater than or equal to 120°C, the estimate of the geothermal potential expressed as thermal energy obtainable per year (MWh/year) is shown. This estimate was made using the volume method. - Map developed by RSE S.p.A. starting from the data collected in the Inventory of National Geothermal Resources available on the website of the Ministry of Ecological Transition - UNMIG (https://unmig.mise.gov.it/index.php/it/dati/risorse-geotermiche/inventario-delle-risorse-geotermiche-nazionali).
